title: Kirchhoff loop - equation for 2 emfs 3 resistors

content.question: The circuit shown in the figure contains two batteries, three resistors, a closed switch, and an open switch. The battery <math alttext="e m f s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emfs</mi></math> as well as the resistances and currents for the resistors are as indicated. Which of the following equations is a correct application of Kirchhoff’s loop rule for the circuit?

choices.label: <math alttext="uppercase script E sub 1, end sub, minus I sub 1, end sub, times R sub 1, end sub, minus I sub 2, end sub, times R sub 2, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="uppercase script E sub 2, end sub, plus I sub 2, end sub, times R sub 2, end sub, plus I sub 3, end sub, times R sub 3, end sub, minus I sub 1, end sub, times R sub 1, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="uppercase script E sub 2, end sub, plus uppercase script E sub 1, end sub, minus I sub 3, end sub, times R sub 3, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="uppercase script E sub 2, end sub, plus uppercase script E sub 1, end sub, minus I sub 3, end sub, times R sub 3, end sub, minus I sub 2, end sub, times R sub 2, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="uppercase script E sub 2, end sub, plus I sub 2, end sub, times R sub 2, end sub, plus I sub 3, end sub, times R sub 3, end sub, minus I sub 1, end sub, times R sub 1, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>
